New Records: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 35 points, 13 rebounds, and five assists in the game.
Memphis Grizzlies won the game 119-104 against the Dallas Mavericks.
Key Match Events: Memphis Grizzlies came back in the fourth quarter to take the lead by 13 points.
The Grizzlies dominated with 52 points in the paint and outrebounded the Mavericks 55-50.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks were missing their top two scorers, Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving, due to injuries.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks have now lost five straight games after this defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jaren Jackson Jr.'s performance included a 56.5% field goal percentage and three steals.
Others: The game was significant as it highlighted the impact of key player absences on the Mavericks' performance.
